deprecation.reason: Each server behaves differently. Use server specific properties instead.

properties.name: server.max-http-post-size

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.domain
properties.description: Domain for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.http-only
properties.description: Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.max-age
properties.description: Maximum age of the cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. A positive value indicates when the cookie expires relative to the current time. A value of 0 means the cookie should expire immediately. A negative value means no "Max-Age".

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.name
properties.description: Name for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.partitioned
properties.description: Whether the generated cookie carries the Partitioned attribute.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.path
properties.description: Path of the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.same-site
properties.description: SameSite setting for the cookie.

properties.name: server.reactive.session.cookie.secure
properties.description: Whether to always mark the cookie as secure.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable http encoding support.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests and responses.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force-request
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests. Defaults to true when force has not been specified.

properties.name: server.servlet.encoding.force-response
properties.description: Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP responses.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.allow-request-override
properties.description: Whether HttpServletRequest attributes are allowed to override (hide) controller generated model attributes of the same name. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.allow-session-override
properties.description: Whether HttpSession attributes are allowed to override (hide) controller generated model attributes of the same name. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.cache
properties.description: Whether to enable template caching. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.content-type
properties.description: Content-Type value. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.expose-request-attributes
properties.description: Whether all request attributes should be added to the model prior to merging with the template. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.expose-session-attributes
properties.description: Whether all HttpSession attributes should be added to the model prior to merging with the template. Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.name: spring.freemarker.expose-spring-macro-helpers
properties.description: Whether to expose a RequestContext for use by Spring's macro library, under the name "springMacroRequestContext". Only supported with Spring MVC.

properties.description: Preferred JSON mapper to use for HTTP message conversion. By default, auto-detected according to the environment. Supported values are 'jackson', 'gson', and 'jsonb'. When other json mapping libraries (such as kotlinx.serialization) are present, use a custom HttpMessageConverters bean to control the preferred mapper.

values.description: Read from any node.
Read from any replica node.
Read from the node with the lowest latency during topology discovery.
Read from any node that has RedisURI matching with the given pattern.
Read from the replica only.
Read preferred from replica and fall back to upstream if no replica is available.
Read from any node in the subnets.
Read from the upstream only.
Read preferred from the upstream and fall back to a replica if the upstream is not available.
Messages sent or received from the session are automatically acknowledged. This is the simplest mode and enables once-only message delivery guarantee.

Messages are acknowledged once the message listener implementation has called "jakarta.jms.Message#acknowledge()". This mode gives the application (rather than the JMS provider) complete control over message acknowledgement.
Similar to auto acknowledgment except that said acknowledgment is lazy. As a consequence, the messages might be delivered more than once. This mode enables at-least-once message delivery guarantee.
Messages sent or received from the session are automatically acknowledged. This is the simplest mode and enables once-only message delivery guarantee.

Messages are acknowledged once the message listener implementation has called "jakarta.jms.Message#acknowledge()". This mode gives the application (rather than the JMS provider) complete control over message acknowledgement.
Similar to auto acknowledgment except that said acknowledgment is lazy. As a consequence, the messages might be delivered more than once. This mode enables at-least-once message delivery guarantee.
Create the schema and destroy previous data.
Create and then destroy the schema at the end of the session.
Create the schema.
Drop the schema.
Disable DDL handling.
Truncate the tables in the schema.
Update the schema if necessary.
Validate the schema, make no changes to the database.
Automatically reset the offset to the earliest offset.
Automatically reset the offset to the latest offset.
Throw exception to the consumer if no previous offset is found for the consumer's group.
Throw exception to the consumer.
Example date format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local date format.
Example date-time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local date-time format.
ISO offset date-time format.
Example time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local time format.
ISO offset time format.
Example date format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local date format.
Example date-time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local date-time format.
ISO offset date-time format.
Example time format. Any format supported by DateTimeFormatter.parse can be used.
ISO-8601 extended local time format.
ISO offset time format.
